dc_title_s: ESRI Data & Maps 2006 : Canada Major Cities
dc_description_s: Canada Major Cities represent the locations of major cities within Canada. A major city is defined as: a populated place that has been designated as a provincial or federal capital by Statistics Canada, or a populated place that has been designated as a city by Natural Resources Canada and has a population greater than 100,000, or a populated place that has been designated as urban by Statistics Canada, a city by Natural Resources Canada, and has a population within the range of 10,000 - 99,999 people, or a populated place that has been designated as urban by Statistics Canada and a town by Natural Resources Canada.
